Wireless AP Service

NOTICE:

The namespace prefix http://cisco.com/jnap/ has been deprecated but is still supported. All JNAP clients should switch to the new namespace prefix http://linksys.com/jnap/.
Copyright Notice
© 2019 Belkin International, Inc. and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

Change History

Revision Date Notes
4.2.5 2023-06-05 Added MultiLinkOperation service for configuring MLO settings. Includes the following actions:
  • GetMLOSettings
  • SetMLOSettings
4.2.4 2023-04-04 Added the following values to WirelessMode enum, to support 802.11be:
  • 802.11anacaxbe
  • 802.11axbe
4.2.3 2020-04-17 Added optional defaultMixedMode parameter to RadioInfo2 structure, for joint configuration of dual-band radios with differing mixed modes.
4.2.2 2020-03-10 Added the following values to WirelessMode enum, to support 802.11ax:
  • 802.11ax
  • 802.11anacax
  • 802.11bgnax
4.2.1 2019-12-04 Added DynamicFrequencySelection service for configuring DFS settings. Includes the following actions:
  • GetDFSSettings
  • SetDFSSettings
4.2.0 2019-08-30 Added WPSServer5 service to indicate the following actions now require authentication:
  • GetWPSServerSettings
  • IsWPSServerAvailable
Added AdvancedWirelessAP2 service to indicate the following action now requires authentication:
  • GetAdvancedRadioInfo
4.0.3 2019-08-28 Updated WirelessSecurity enum:
  • Added Enhanced-Open-Only
  • Changed Enhanced-Open to Enhanced-Open+None
4.0.2 2019-03-25 Updated WirelessSecurity enum:
  • Added WPA3-Personal
  • Added WPA3-Enterprise
  • Added Enhanced-Open
  • Added WPA2/WPA3-Mixed-Personal
4.1.0 2018-01-24 Added WPSServer4 to indicate support for extended WPS PBC sessions.

StartWPSServerSession now extends the current WPS session, if a session is in progress, rather than returning ErrorWPSSessionAlreadyInProgress.
1.0.2 2017-01-23 Added AirtimeFairness service that supports configuring airtime fairness feature.

Added the following:
  • action GetAirtimeFairnessSettings
  • action SetAirtimeFairnessSettings
1.0.1 2016-04-19 Consolidated WirelessAP2 and WirelessAP3 into WirelessAP4.

Added the following:
  • action GetRadioInfo3
  • action SetRadioSettings3
  • WirelessChannelWidth enum values: Wide160c and Wide160nc

Services

AdvancedWirelessAP

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/AdvancedWirelessAP
This service provides access to advanced properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetAdvancedRadioInfo
  • SetAdvancedRadioSettings

AdvancedWirelessAP2

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/AdvancedWirelessAP2
This service provides access to advanced properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetAdvancedRadioInfo
  • SetAdvancedRadioSettings

AirtimeFairness

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/AirtimeFairness
This service provides access to airtime fairness configuration of the 802.11 wireless access point

Service Actions

  • GetAirtimeFairnessSettings
  • SetAirtimeFairnessSettings

DynamicFrequencySelection

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/DynamicFrequencySelection
This service provides access to dynamic frequency selection (DFS) configuration of the 802.11 wireless access point

Service Actions

  • GetDFSSettings
  • SetDFSSettings

MultiLinkOperation

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/MultiLinkOperation
This service provides access to Multi-Link Operation (MLO) configuration of an 802.11 wireless 7 access point

Service Actions

  • GetMLOSettings
  • SetMLOSettings

WPSServer

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPSServer
This service allows a client to start and stop WPS sessions on the wireless access point using a "soft" pushbutton method rather than a physical button on the AP.

Service Actions

  • GetWPSServerSessionStatus
  • StartWPSServerSession
  • StopWPSServerSession

WPSServer2

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPSServer2
This service extends the WPSServer service, allowing a client to provision the WPS server settings on the wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetWPSServerSessionStatus
  • GetWPSServerSettings
  • SetWPSServerSettings
  • StartWPSServerSession
  • StopWPSServerSession

WPSServer3

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPSServer3
This service extends the WPSServer service, informing the client of the availability of the WPS server

Service Actions

  • GetWPSServerSessionStatus
  • GetWPSServerSettings
  • IsWPSServerAvailable
  • SetWPSServerSettings
  • StartWPSServerSession
  • StopWPSServerSession

WPSServer4

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPSServer4
This service extends the WPSServer service, informing the client of the availability of the WPS server

Service Actions

  • GetWPSServerSessionStatus
  • GetWPSServerSettings
  • IsWPSServerAvailable
  • SetWPSServerSettings
  • StartWPSServerSession
  • StopWPSServerSession

WPSServer5

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPSServer5
This service extends the WPSServer service, informing the client of the availability of the WPS server

Service Actions

  • GetWPSServerSessionStatus
  • GetWPSServerSettings
  • IsWPSServerAvailable
  • SetWPSServerSettings
  • StartWPSServerSession
  • StopWPSServerSession

WirelessAP

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessAP
This service provides access to properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point.

Service Actions

  • GetRadioInfo
  • SetRadioSettings

WirelessAP2

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessAP2
This service provides access to properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point. The service is being rev'd to allow the UI to determine that a reboot is not required after toggling 'broadcastSSID' (RAINIER-9032).

Service Actions

  • GetRadioInfo
  • SetRadioSettings

WirelessAP4

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessAP4
This service provides access to properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point. WirelessAP2 and WirelessAP3 have been consolidated into WirelessAP4

Service Actions

  • GetRadioInfo3
  • SetRadioSettings3

Actions

GetAdvancedRadioInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetAdvancedRadioInfo
This action gets advanced settings for all of the wireless access point's wireless radios.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
radios AdvancedRadioInfo[] no The list of advanced settings for each radio.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetAdvancedRadioInfoResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetAdvancedRadioInfo"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "radios": [
      {
        "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
        "supportedRatesMbps": [
          123
        ],
        "supportedNRatesMbps": [
          "example string"
        ],
        "settings": {
          "apIsolation": true,
          "frameburst": false,
          "ctsProtection": true,
          "rateMbps": 0,
          "nRateMbps": "6.5",
          "basicRate": "Default",
          "transmissionPower": "Medium",
          "greenfieldPreamble": true,
          "htDuplicate": true,
          "spaceTimeBlockCode": true,
          "wirelessMultimediaPowerSave": true,
          "beaconIntervalMilliseconds": 5432,
          "dtimIntervalMilliseconds": 212,
          "fragmentationThresholdBytes": 700,
          "rtsThresholdBytes": 900,
          "wepAuthentication": "Auto",
          "sidebandSelection": "Auto",
          "pmfEnabled": true
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

GetAirtimeFairnessSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetAirtimeFairnessSettings
This action gets the airtime fairness settings of the wireless access point.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isAirtimeFairnessSupported bool no Whether airtime fairness feature is supported.
isAirtimeFairnessEnabled bool yes Whether airtime fairness is currently enabled. This value exists if and only if isAirtimeFairnessSupported is true

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetAirtimeFairnessSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetAirtimeFairnessSettings"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isAirtimeFairnessSupported": true,
    "isAirtimeFairnessEnabled": true
  }
}

GetDFSSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetDFSSettings
This action gets the dynamic frequency selection (DFS) settings of the wireless access point.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isDFSSupported bool no Whether the DFS feature is supported.
isDFSEnabled bool yes Whether DFS is currently enabled. This value exists if and only if isDFSSupported is true

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetDFSSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isDFSSupported": true,
    "isDFSEnabled": true
  }
}

GetRadioInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetRadioInfo
This action gets information and settings for all of the wireless access point's wireless radios.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
radios RadioInfo[] no The list of information and settings for each radio.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetRadioInfoResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetRadioInfo"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "radios": [
      {
        "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
        "physicalRadioID": "wdev0",
        "bssid": "00:22:5F:A1:73:C1",
        "band": "2.4GHz",
        "supportedModes": [
          "802.11a"
        ],
        "supportedChannels": [
          123
        ],
        "supportedWideChannels": [
          123
        ],
        "supportedSecurityTypes": [
          "None"
        ],
        "maxRADIUSSharedKeyLength": 64,
        "settings": {
          "isEnabled": true,
          "mode": "802.11bgn",
          "ssid": "Grilled-Cheese",
          "broadcastSSID": true,
          "channelWidth": "Standard",
          "channel": 0,
          "security": "WPA2-Personal",
          "wpaPersonalSettings": {
            "passphrase": "grilled cheese is the new internet"
          },
          "wpaEnterpriseSettings": {
            "radiusServer": "192.168.1.200",
            "radiusPort": 1812,
            "sharedKey": "no grilled cheese in my enterprise, thanks"
          }
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

GetRadioInfo3

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetRadioInfo3
This action gets information and settings for all of the wireless access point's wireless radios. This consolidates GetRadioInfo and GetRadioInfo2. On top of that, this will now return supported channels for each supported channel width.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
supportedBandSteeringModes BandSteeringMode[] yes Supported band steering modes. This value exists if and only if isBandSteeringSupported is true.
isBandSteeringEnabled bool yes Whether band steering is enabled. This value exists if and only if isBandSteeringSupported is true.
bandSteeringMode BandSteeringMode yes The band steering mode. This value exists if and only if isBandSteeringSupported is true.
isBandSteeringSupported bool no Whether band steering is supported by router.
radios RadioInfo2[] no The list of information and settings for each radio.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetRadioInfo3Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetRadioInfo3"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "supportedBandSteeringModes": [
      "Basic"
    ],
    "isBandSteeringEnabled": true,
    "bandSteeringMode": "Basic",
    "isBandSteeringSupported": false,
    "radios": [
      {
        "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
        "physicalRadioID": "wdev0",
        "bssid": "00:22:5F:A1:73:C1",
        "band": "2.4GHz",
        "supportedModes": [
          "802.11a"
        ],
        "defaultMixedMode": "802.11a",
        "supportedChannelsForChannelWidths": [
          {
            "channelWidth": "Auto",
            "channels": [
              123
            ]
          }
        ],
        "supportedSecurityTypes": [
          "None"
        ],
        "maxRADIUSSharedKeyLength": 64,
        "settings": {
          "isEnabled": true,
          "mode": "802.11bgn",
          "ssid": "Grilled-Cheese",
          "broadcastSSID": true,
          "channelWidth": "Standard",
          "channel": 0,
          "security": "WPA2-Personal",
          "wpaPersonalSettings": {
            "passphrase": "grilled cheese is the new internet"
          },
          "wpaEnterpriseSettings": {
            "radiusServer": "192.168.1.200",
            "radiusPort": 1812,
            "sharedKey": "no grilled cheese in my enterprise, thanks"
          }
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

GetWPSServerSessionStatus

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetWPSServerSessionStatus
This action gets the status of the WPS session, if any, that is currently in progress on the wireless access point.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isWPSSessionInProgress bool no Whether a WPS session is currently in progress.
serverPIN string no The WPS server's PIN number.
lastResult WPSSessionResult yes The result of the last WPS session, if present.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetWPSServerSessionStatusResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetWPSServerSessionStatus"

{
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK",
  "output": {
    "isWPSSessionInProgress": true,
    "serverPIN": "04840954",
    "lastResult": "Failed"
  }
}

SetAdvancedRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetAdvancedRadioSettings
This action sets advacned settings for one or more of the wireless access point's wireless radios.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
radios NewAdvancedRadioSettings[] no The list of advanced settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetAdvancedRadioSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorInvalidBasicRate The wireless basic transmission rate for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorInvalidBeaconInterval The beacon interval for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorInvalidDTIMInterval The DTIM interval for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorInvalidFragmentationThreshold The fragmentation threshold for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorInvalidRTSThreshold The RTS threshold for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorInvalidSidebandSelection The sideband selection for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorInvalidTransmissionPower The transmission power value for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorInvalidWEPAuthentication The WEP authentication for one or more radios is invalid.
ErrorUnknownRadio One of the specified radio IDs does not correspond to an actual radio in the access point.
ErrorUnsupportedNRate One of the specified wireless 802.11n transmission rates is not supported by that radio.
ErrorUnsupportedRate One of the specified wireless transmission rates is not supported by that radio.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetAdvancedRadioSettings"

{
  "radios": [
    {
      "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
      "settings": {
        "apIsolation": true,
        "frameburst": false,
        "ctsProtection": true,
        "rateMbps": 0,
        "nRateMbps": "6.5",
        "basicRate": "Default",
        "transmissionPower": "Medium",
        "greenfieldPreamble": true,
        "htDuplicate": true,
        "spaceTimeBlockCode": true,
        "wirelessMultimediaPowerSave": true,
        "beaconIntervalMilliseconds": 5432,
        "dtimIntervalMilliseconds": 212,
        "fragmentationThresholdBytes": 700,
        "rtsThresholdBytes": 900,
        "wepAuthentication": "Auto",
        "sidebandSelection": "Auto",
        "pmfEnabled": true
      }
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

SetAirtimeFairnessSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetAirtimeFairnessSettings
This action sets the airtime fairness settings of the wireless access point.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isAirtimeFairnessEnabled bool no Whether airtime fairness should be enabled.

SetRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetRadioSettings
This action sets information and settings for one or more of the wireless access point's wireless radios.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
radios NewRadioSettings[] no The list of settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetRadioSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorBandSteeringIsEnabled Band steering is currently enabled. Use SetRadioSettings2to change the radio settings.
ErrorGuestSSIDConflict One of the specified SSIDs is conflicting with another SSID on the guest network that is currently enabled.
ErrorInvalidKey One of the specified WEP keys was not valid.
ErrorInvalidPassphrase One of the specified WPA passphrases was not valid.
ErrorInvalidRADIUSPort One of the specified RADIUS port values was not valid.
ErrorInvalidRADIUSServer One of the specified RADIUS servers was not valid.
ErrorInvalidSSID One of the specified SSIDs was not between 1 and 32 bytes long.
ErrorInvalidSharedKey One of the specified WPA-Enterprise shared keys was not valid.
ErrorInvalidTXKey One of the specified WEP TX key values was not between 1 and 4.
ErrorMissingWEPSettings One of the specified wireless security types was WEP, but no WEP settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorMissingWPAEnterpriseSettings One of the specified wireless security types was a WPA-Enterprise variant, but the no WPA-Enterprise settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorMissingWPAPersonalSettings One of the specified wireless security types was a WPA-Personal variant, but no WPA-Personal settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorUnknownRadio One of the specified radio IDs does not correspond to an actual radio in the access point.
ErrorUnsupportedChannel One of the specified wireless channels is not supported by that radio.
ErrorUnsupportedChannelWidth One of specified channel widths is not supported for the current wireless configuration. For example, specifying a channel width "Wide" is not supported with a wireless mode of "802.11a".
ErrorUnsupportedMode One of the specified radios does not support the wireless mode that was specified for it.
ErrorUnsupportedSecurity One of the specified radios does not support the wireless security type that was specified for it.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetRadioSettings"

{
  "radios": [
    {
      "radioID": "RADIO_2.4GHz",
      "settings": {
        "isEnabled": true,
        "mode": "802.11bgn",
        "ssid": "Grilled-Cheese",
        "broadcastSSID": true,
        "channelWidth": "Standard",
        "channel": 0,
        "security": "WPA2-Personal",
        "wpaPersonalSettings": {
          "passphrase": "grilled cheese is the new internet"
        },
        "wpaEnterpriseSettings": {
          "radiusServer": "192.168.1.200",
          "radiusPort": 1812,
          "sharedKey": "no grilled cheese in my enterprise, thanks"
        }
      }
    }
  ]
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"

SetRadioSettings3

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetRadioSettings3
This action sets information and settings for one or more of the wireless access point's wireless radios.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
isBandSteeringEnabled bool yes Whether band steering is enabled. This is required if isBandSteeringSupported returned by GetRadioInfo3 is true.
bandSteeringMode BandSteeringMode yes The band steering mode. This is required if isBandSteeringEnabled is true.
radios NewRadioSettings[] no The list of settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetRadioSettings3Result
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorBandSteeringNotSupported Band steering is not supported on this platform.
ErrorGuestSSIDConflict One of the specified SSIDs is conflicting with another SSID on the guest network that is currently enabled.
ErrorInvalidBandSteeringMode Band steering mode specified is not valid.
ErrorInvalidBandSteeringRadioSettings Band steering is enabled but the radio settings specified do not match.
ErrorInvalidKey One of the specified WEP keys was not valid.
ErrorInvalidPassphrase One of the specified WPA passphrases was not valid.
ErrorInvalidRADIUSPort One of the specified RADIUS port values was not valid.
ErrorInvalidRADIUSServer One of the specified RADIUS servers was not valid.
ErrorInvalidSSID One of the specified SSIDs was not between 1 and 32 bytes long.
ErrorInvalidSharedKey One of the specified WPA-Enterprise shared keys was not valid.
ErrorInvalidTXKey One of the specified WEP TX key values was not between 1 and 4.
ErrorMissingBandSteeringMode Band steering is supported, but bandSteeringMode is not specified.
ErrorMissingIsBandSteeringEnabled Band steering is supported, but isBandSteeringEnabled is not specified.
ErrorMissingWEPSettings One of the specified wireless security types was WEP, but no WEP settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorMissingWPAEnterpriseSettings One of the specified wireless security types was a WPA-Enterprise variant, but the no WPA-Enterprise settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorMissingWPAPersonalSettings One of the specified wireless security types was a WPA-Personal variant, but no WPA-Personal settings were specified for that radio.
ErrorSuperfluousBandSteeringMode bandSteeringMode was specified even though band steering is disabled.
ErrorUnknownRadio One of the specified radio IDs does not correspond to an actual radio in the access point.
ErrorUnsupportedChannel One of the specified wireless channels is not supported by that radio.
ErrorUnsupportedChannelWidth One of specified channel widths is not supported for the current wireless configuration. For example, specifying a channel width "Wide" is not supported with a wireless mode of "802.11a".
ErrorUnsupportedMode One of the specified radios does not support the wireless mode that was specified for it.
ErrorUnsupportedSecurity One of the specified radios does not support the wireless security type that was specified for it.

_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

StartWPSServerSession

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/StartWPSServerSession
This action starts a WPS session on the wireless access point.

Note:

This action is safe to call within the context of a transaction.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
clientPIN string yes The client-supplied PIN, if any, to use for the WPS session. If this value is not present, the WPS session will be in pushbutton mode and will not use a client PIN. If this value is present, it must be a valid 4 or 8 digit WPS PIN. 8-digit PINs will be verified using the checksum algorithm defined in the WPS specification.

Output Parameters

This action does not have any output parameters.

Result

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/StartWPSServerSessionResult
Value Description
OK Success.
Error
ErrorInvalidClientPIN The specified client PIN is not valid.
ErrorWPSServerNotEnabled The WPS server is not enabled.
_ErrorAbortedAction
_ErrorInvalidInput
_ErrorInvalidOutput
_ErrorNotReady
_ErrorSessionVerification
_ErrorUnauthorized
_ErrorUnexpected
_ErrorUnknownAction
_ErrorUnknownSession

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
X-JNAP-Action: "http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/StartWPSServerSession"

{
  "clientPIN": "07121976"
}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

{
  "result": "OK"
}

Structures

AdvancedRadioInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/AdvancedRadioInfo
Advanced settings of a wireless radio. This structure is returned from the GetAdvancedRadioInfo action.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio. This value never changes for a particular radio, and no two radios on the same wireless access point will have the same radio ID.
supportedRatesMbps int[] no The list of supported transmission rates, in megabits per second, that the radio supports. The presence of the value 0 in this list indicates that the radio supports transmission rate auto-selection.
supportedNRatesMbps string[] no The list of supported 802.11n transmission rates, in megabits per second, that the radio supports. The presence of the value 0 in this list indicates that the radio supports transmission rate auto-selection.
settings AdvancedRadioSettings no The radio's current advanced settings.

AdvancedRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/AdvancedRadioSettings
A wireless radio's advanced settings.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
apIsolation bool yes Is AP isolation enabled? If enabled, all traffic between wireless client stations will be dropped. In other words, wireless device to wireless device direct communication will fail.
frameburst bool yes Is frameburst emabled? This will allow a wireless client station to send multiple frames between wait periods, thus increasing upload throughput. It is only recommend for WLANs with few (1-3) clients.
ctsProtection bool yes Is CTS protection mode enabled? This value will ensure that 802.11b wireless client stations can connect to an 802.11g access point when 802.11g wireless client stations are also connected. This will negatively affect performance.
rateMbps int yes The fixed transmission rate, in Megabits per second. 0 indicates that the radio supports transmission rate auto-selection.
nRateMbps string yes The fixed 802.11n transmission rate, in Megabits per second. 0 indicates that the radio supports transmission rate auto-selection.
basicRate WirelessBasicTransmissionRate yes The basic transmission rate set.
transmissionPower WirelessTransmissionPower yes The relative wireless transmission power.
greenfieldPreamble bool yes Is the Greenfield preamble enabled?
htDuplicate bool yes HT Duplicate
spaceTimeBlockCode bool yes Space Time Block Code
wirelessMultimediaPowerSave bool yes Wireless Multimedia Power Save
beaconIntervalMilliseconds int yes The beacon interval, in milliseconds. This must be between 1 and 65535.
dtimIntervalMilliseconds int yes The DTIM interval. in milliseconds. This must be between 1 and 255.
fragmentationThresholdBytes int yes The fragmentation threshold, in bytes. This must be between 256 and 2346.
rtsThresholdBytes int yes The RTS threshold, in bytes. This must be between 0 and 2347.
wepAuthentication WEPAuthentication yes The WEP authentication type.
sidebandSelection SidebandSelection yes The sideband selection for 40MHz for bandwidth channels
pmfEnabled bool yes Is protected management frame enabled?

NewAdvancedRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/NewAdvancedRadioSettings
Desired advanced settings for a wireless radio. This structure is used to change radio advanced settings with the SetAdvancedRadioSettings action. Only values present in the AdvancedRadioSettings structure will be applied.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio.
settings AdvancedRadioSettings no The radio's desired advanced settings.

NewRadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/NewRadioSettings
Desired settings for a wireless radio. This structure is used to change radio settings with the SetRadioSettings action.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio.
settings RadioSettings no The radio's desired settings.

RadioInfo

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/RadioInfo
Information about and current settings of a wireless radio. This structure is returned from the GetRadioInfo action.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio. This value never changes for a particular radio, and no two radios on the same wireless access point will have the same radio ID.
physicalRadioID string no The unique identifier of the physical radio hardware. This value never changes for a particular radio. However, multiple radios within the wireless access point may have the same physical radio ID if the access point has a selectable-band radio. In this case, radios that have the same physical radio ID represent mutually-exclusive configurations of the same physical radio, and modifying settings of one radio will cause the settings of the other radio to be modified as well. Only one of the radios that share a physical radio can be enabled at any given time; enabling such a radio will cause the other radios to be disabled.
bssid MACAddress no The radio's BSSID.
band WirelessBand no The radio's wireless frequency band.
supportedModes WirelessMode[] no The list of wireless modes that the radio supports.
supportedChannels int[] no The list of standard (20 MHz) wireless channels that the radio supports The presence of the value 0 in this list indicates that the radio supports channel auto-selection. Note that the list of supported channels depends on the access point's configured locale, since certain channels are only supported in certain regions.
supportedWideChannels int[] no The list of wide (40 MHz) wireless channels that the radio supports The presence of the value 0 in this list indicates that the radio supports wide channel auto-selection. This list may be empty if the radio does not support wide channels. Note that the list of supported wide channels depends on the access point's configured locale, since certain wide channels are only supported in certain regions.
supportedSecurityTypes WirelessSecurity[] no The list of wireless security types that the radio supports.
maxRADIUSSharedKeyLength int no The maximum allowed length, in bytes, of a RADIUS shared key value.
settings RadioSettings no The radio's current settings.

RadioInfo2

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/RadioInfo2
Information about and current settings of a wireless radio. This structure is returned from the GetRadioInfo3 action.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radioID string no The unique identifier of the radio. This value never changes for a particular radio, and no two radios on the same wireless access point will have the same radio ID.
physicalRadioID string no The unique identifier of the physical radio hardware. This value never changes for a particular radio. However, multiple radios within the wireless access point may have the same physical radio ID if the access point has a selectable-band radio. In this case, radios that have the same physical radio ID represent mutually-exclusive configurations of the same physical radio, and modifying settings of one radio will cause the settings of the other radio to be modified as well. Only one of the radios that share a physical radio can be enabled at any given time; enabling such a radio will cause the other radios to be disabled.
bssid MACAddress no The radio's BSSID.
band WirelessBand no The radio's wireless frequency band.
supportedModes WirelessMode[] no The list of wireless modes that the radio supports.
defaultMixedMode WirelessMode yes The radio's default mixed network mode.
supportedChannelsForChannelWidths SupportedChannelsForChannelWidth[] no The list of supported channels for every supported channel widths.
supportedSecurityTypes WirelessSecurity[] no The list of wireless security types that the radio supports.
maxRADIUSSharedKeyLength int no The maximum allowed length, in bytes, of a RADIUS shared key value.
settings RadioSettings no The radio's current settings.

RadioSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/RadioSettings
A wireless radio's settings.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
isEnabled bool no Whether the radio is enabled.
mode WirelessMode no The radio's mode.
ssid string no The radio's SSID. The maximum length of this value is 32 bytes.
broadcastSSID bool no Whether SSID broadcast is enabled.
channelWidth WirelessChannelWidth no The wireless channel width that the radio operates on. Note that "Wide" is not allowed when mode is set to "802.11a". 802.11a does not support wide channels.
channel int no The wireless channel the radio should operate on. The value 0 indicates that the wireless access point should auto-select the channel.
security WirelessSecurity no The radio's security type.
wepSettings WEPSettings yes The radio's WEP settings. When getting wireless radio settings, this value will be present if and only if the value of the security member is WEP. When setting wireless radio settings, this value is required if the value of the security member is WEP; if the security is not WEP, this value is ignored if present.
wpaPersonalSettings WPAPersonalSettings yes The radio's WPA-Personal settings. When getting wireless radio settings, this value will be present if and only if the value of the security member is a WPA-Personal variant. When setting wireless radio settings, this value is required if the value of the security member is a WPA-Personal variant; if the security is not a WPA-Personal variant, this value is ignored if present.
wpaEnterpriseSettings WPAEnterpriseSettings yes The radio's WPA-Enterprise settings. When getting wireless radio settings, this value will be present if and only if the value of the security member is a WPA-Enterprise variant. When setting wireless radio settings, this value is required if the value of the security member is a WPA-Enterprise variant; if the security is not a WPA-Enterprise variant, this value is ignored if present.

SupportedChannelsForChannelWidth

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SupportedChannelsForChannelWidth
Possible wireless channel selections given a channel width

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
channelWidth WirelessChannelWidth no The channel width for this set of supported channels
channels int[] no The list of supported channels for the channel width.

WEPSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WEPSettings
Settings used when a wireless radio's security type is WEP.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
encryption WEPEncryption no The WEP encryption type.
key1 string no The first WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
key2 string no The second WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
key3 string no The third WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
key4 string no The fourth WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.
txKey int no The index specifying which key value to use for encryption. The value of the corresponding key cannot be an empty string. This value must be between 1 and 4.

WPAEnterpriseSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPAEnterpriseSettings
Settings used when a wireless radio's security type is a WPA-Enterprise variant.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
radiusServer IPAddress no The IP address of the RADIUS server.
The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the RADIUS server address.
Address Block Description Reference
0.0.0.0/8 "This" Network RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
127.0.0.0/8 Loopback RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
169.254.0.0/16 Link Local RFC 3927
224.0.0.0/4 Multicast RFC 3171
240.0.0.0/4 Reserved for Future Use RFC 1112, Section 4
255.255.255.255/32 Limited Broadcast RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7
radiusPort int no The port number of the RADIUS server.
sharedKey string no The RADIUS shared secret. This value must be composed entirely of characters in the range U+0032 - U+007E (printable ASCII) and cannot be an empty string.

WPAPersonalSettings

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPAPersonalSettings
Settings used when a wireless radio's security type is a WPA-Personal variant.

Structure Members

Member Name Type Optional Description
passphrase string no The WPA passphrase. This value must either be a 8-63 characters in the range U+0032 - U+007E (printable ASCII) or exactly 64 ASCII hexadecimal digits.

Enumerations

BandSteeringMode

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/BandSteeringMode
Wireless band steering mode.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Basic Band steering mode between two 5GHz radios.
TriBand Band steering mode across all three radios.

SidebandSelection

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SidebandSelection
Sideband selection for 40Mhz channels.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Auto
Upper
Lower

WEPAuthentication

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WEPAuthentication
The WEP authentication type. This is the authentication type used only for WEP-based security.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Auto Automatically choose the authentication type for each wireless client station.
Open Use open-system authentication. Wireless client stations will not be required to authenticate to complete the 802.11 association process.
SharedKey Use shared key authentication. Wireless clients must prove ownership of the WEP shared secret as part of the 802.11 association process.

WEPEncryption

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WEPEncryption
Types of WEP encryption.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
WEP-64 64-bit WEP encryption with a 40-bit key. This value should only be used when the security type is WEP.
WEP-128 128-bit WEP encryption with a 104-bit key. This value should only be used when the security type is WEP.

WPSSessionResult

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WPSSessionResult
WPS session result

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Failed The last WPS session failed.
Succeeded The last WPS session succeeded.

WirelessBand

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessBand
This service provides access to properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point. Wireless frequency bands.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
2.4GHz The 2.4GHz frequency band.
5GHz The 5GHz frequency band.
6GHz The 6GHz frequency band.

WirelessBasicTransmissionRate

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessBasicTransmissionRate
The allowed set of basic wireless transmission rates. This value is used primarily to allow the radio to support legacy 802.11b wireless client stations.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Default Use the default rate set for the currently configured wireless mode. This should be used to ensure compatibility with the widest range of devices.
All Allow all data rates supported by the radio.
802.11bCompatible Use only data rates supported by 802.11b devices (i.e. 1-2Mbps). This should only be used for backwards compatibility with legacy 802.11b devices.

WirelessChannelWidth

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessChannelWidth
Possible wireless channel widths.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Auto The wireless access point will automatically determine the wireless channel width.
Standard The wireless channel is 20 MHz wide.
Wide The wireless channel is 40 MHz wide.
Wide80 The wireless channel is 80 MHz wide.
Wide160c The wireless channel is contiguous 160 MHz wide.
Wide160nc The wireless channel is non-contiguous 160 MHz wide.

WirelessMode

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessMode
Modes representing types of wireless traffic that a wireless radio will accept.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
802.11a The radio only accepts 802.11a traffic.
802.11b The radio only accepts 802.11b traffic.
802.11g The radio only accepts 802.11g traffic.
802.11n The radio only accepts 802.11n traffic.
802.11ac The radio only accepts 802.11ac traffic.
802.11ax The radio only accepts 802.11ax traffic.
802.11an The radio only accepts 802.11a and 802.11n traffic.
802.11bg The radio only accepts 802.11b and 802.11g traffic.
802.11bn The radio only accepts 802.11b and 802.11n traffic.
802.11gn The radio only accepts 802.11g and 802.11n traffic.
802.11anac The radio only accepts 802.11a, 802.11n, and 802.11ac traffic.
802.11anacax The radio only accepts 802.11a, 802.11n, 802.11ac and 802.11ax traffic.
802.11anacaxbe The radio only accepts 802.11a, 802.11n, 802.11ac, 802.11ax and 802.11be traffic.
802.11bgn The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, and 802.11n traffic.
802.11bgnac The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, 802.11n and 802.11ac traffic.
802.11bgnax The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, 802.11n and 802.11ax traffic.
802.11axbe The radio only accepts 802.11ax and 802.11be traffic.
802.11mixed The radio accepts mixed mode traffic.

WirelessSecurity

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessSecurity
Wireless security types supported by a wireless radio. Each security type represents a combination of an 802.11 wireless protocol, authentication, and encryption. All possible combinations are not represented, only those that are reasonable options for a modern wireless access point to expose.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
None No authentication or encryption; commonly referred to as "open".
WEP WEP protocol with no authentication and WEP encryption using a preshared key; commonly referred to as "WEP shared".
WPA-Personal WPA protocol with preshared-key authentication and TKIP encryption.
WPA-Enterprise WPA protocol with RADIUS authentication and TKIP encryption.
WPA2-Personal WPA2 protocol with preshared-key authentication and AES encryption.
WPA2-Enterprise WPA2 protocol with RADIUS authentication and AES encryption.
WPA-Mixed-Personal Either WPA-Personal or WPA2-Personal.
WPA-Mixed-Enterprise Either WPA-Enterprise or WPA2-Enterprise.
WPA2/WPA3-Mixed-Personal Either WPA2-Personal or WPA3-Personal.
WPA3-Personal WPA3 protocol with preshared-key authentication and AES encryption.
WPA3-Enterprise WPA3 protocol with RADIUS authentication and AES encryption.
Enhanced-Open+None Wi-Fi Alliance®'s Wi-Fi CERTIFIED Enhanced Open™ OWE Transition mode. See http://wi-fi.org/enhanced-open.
Enhanced-Open-Only Wi-Fi Alliance®'s Wi-Fi CERTIFIED Enhanced Open™ OWE Only mode. See http://wi-fi.org/enhanced-open.

WirelessTransmissionPower

http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessTransmissionPower
Wireless transmission power.

Enumeration Values

Value Description
Low Low transmission power.
Medium Medium transmission power.
High High transmission power.
